page.title: 15Living in Swallownest
page.content: I think Swallownest is a nice area to live in because you have the local shops and bank just down the road. I prefer little shops because they are more personal, although things there are dearer than in supermarkets. In the village centre there are also two nurseries and a hairdresser. We have a local swimming pool and a park. Swallownest is more attractive in some parts than others. We have fields round the village but behind them are Orgreave and Brookhouse pits and the sewage works. There is rather a lot of litter and some vandalism in the village. Being a mining village it can be smoky and dusty. There are ponds and lakes for fishing and walks you can enjoy. There is a good bus service from Swallownest to Rotherham or Sheffield. Each year the Annual Aston Gala is held in Swallownest.
